required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Oral Supplementation of Gangliosides to Treat a Rare Metabolic Disorder
clinical_study.official_title: Oral Supplementation of Gangliosides - A Potential Treatment for GM3 Synthase Deficiency

lead_sponsor.agency: DDC Clinic - Center for Special Needs Children

clinical_study.source: DDC Clinic - Center for Special Needs Children

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this pilot project is to see if a supplemental form of dietary gangliosides can serve as a potential treatment for the rare metabolic condition called ganglioside GM3 synthase deficiency.

primary_outcome.measure: Body length compared to normal pediatric growth curves.
primary_outcome.time_frame: Quarterly measures- change from baseline over 24 months.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in scores of standardized developmental assessments (Vineland & Batelle)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Quarterly measures - change from baseline over 24 months

primary_outcome.measure: Body Weight compared to normal pediatric growth curves
primary_outcome.time_frame: Quarterly measurements from baseline over 24 months

primary_outcome.measure: Head circumference compared to normal pediatric growth curves.
primary_outcome.time_frame: Quarterly measures from baseline over 24 months

secondary_outcome.measure: Concentration of ganglioside GM3 in blood plasma
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Six times per year over 24 months

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Clinical diagnosis of GM3 synthase deficiency
Exclusion Criteria:
-
